comments.body: Can you try `export CFLAGS="-Wall -g -m64 -pipe -O2  -fPIC $CFLAGS"` so we don't loose the pre-defined `CFLAGS`? Same is valid for all the env vars below.
I thought I pushed that change.  I am in a meeting in Seattle, I will be back to my office next week and I can make the change.
I would rather if this was sent upstream, if this is an essential part of installing `uv-cdat`, or if you dropped it as a script in the `SRC_DIR` to make it easier to review/update.

Will do.  Many Python packages using UV-CDAT has `import cdat_info`.  I thought I would start with this package to learn about conda-forge.  I will work on a better way to to code this script.  Thanks for your help!

hum all of our packages use some parts of this, uv-cdat used to be a big monolithic code and we split it in smaller more or less independent pieces now. But cdat_info is sort of a reference for all pacakges to know what's going on. for example they all use pingDB/get_sample_data_path, etc.. function to send (if user approved of course) anonymous usage info to help us improve the software. 
I'm not sure what your issue against the package is? Is it because it does not really have any reason to be as a stand-alone?

> . But cdat_info is sort of a reference for all pacakges to know what's going on. for example they all use pingDB/get_sample_data_path, etc.. function to send (if user approved of course) anonymous usage info to help us improve the software.

I guess that, as a packager, I don't really get what you are doing with that script. It does seems like it should be its own standalone package though.

> I'm not sure what your issue against the package is?

I don't understand the question. My comment is that `cdat_info.py.in` contains a lot of instructions to be in the `build.sh`. If they make sense as a standalone package or as part of the upstream software it would make more sense. If not, then we should add it as a separate file here for maintainability's sake.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +6,10 @@export GIT_DESCRIBE=`git describe --tags`

cat > cdat_info.py.in << EOF

Version = 'GIT_DESCRIBE'
